result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen R Steinke II was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:

Court grants 35 days credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Restitution to be paid to Walmart joint and severally with the Co-Defendant. To be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Court Costs to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

Pay all court costs, DNA and restitution.
Comply with any other conditions set by Agent.
DNA sample if not yet provided.

Cases 14CM233 and 14CM197 were both dismissed and read into: 14CF287 and 13CF1498.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: September 15, 2014 Bail/Bond Hearing.    Envelope: Return to Sender - Not Deliverable as Addressed - Unable to Forward. "RTS Rels"  "RLSE"
Pretrial Incarceration Credit form filed filed by the State.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Allen R Steinke in court, in custody, with attorney Chris Bailey.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 2 years (Initial Confinement: 1 year - 35 days credit, Extended Supervision: 1 year) concurrent to 13CF1498
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- Court Costs of $268.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision; alternate 6 days jail consecutive
- Restitution of $449.97 to be paid to Walmart joint and severally with the co-defendant as a Condition of Extended Supervision
- DNA Surcharge of $250.00 to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision; alternate 5 days jail consecutive
- Conditions of Extended Supervision: Pay all court cost, DNA and Restitution. Comply with any other conditions set by Agent. DNA Sample if not yet provided
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 2, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Defendant to have no contact with any Walmart Store. Not to use or possess any burglarious tools.

Defendant Allen R Steinke in court, in custody, with attorney Chris Bailey.   Andrea Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for bail/bond hearing. Court sets bail at $500.00 cash. Court orders the Defendant remain in the Waukesha County Jail until the next date. Court orders capias quashed.  Defense requests a date for a plea.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 2, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on September 15, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
